comments:
There appears to be a problem when trying to preview a refactoring operation on
one or more files which contain a file that has a CVS edit open on it. The
preview craps out saying there was an exception, with no details available
(sorry, it is gone now. You can then abort or go ahead. If you go ahead, you get
a message:
  "The resource has already editors. Do you want to edit?"
and when you say ok, the refactor seems to happen ok (although I should add that
previously I had a big blowup on a group of files which I think was due to the
same thing, which I said to back out of, and Eclipse was not actually able to
back out of).

Here is the console log which shows the exception that I think happens in the
preview operation:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.resources 4 2 Mar 03, 2003 18:34:44.910
!MESSAGE Problems occurred when invoking code from plug-in: "org.eclipse.core.re
sources".
!STACK 0

I am not sure if this is related or not, but I want to add that when I now do an
update, the directory which I refactored to move the files out of now comes up
with a message:

CVS Synchronization information could not be found for the folder
'/emulator/src/java/main/com/tira/emulator'.

I have released the fix for the exception to HEAD.

The second problem you mentioned has already been fixed.

You might want to fix the grammar on the message about the editors, too :-)
   "The resource has already editors. Do you want to edit?"
